description.narrative: Kaos GL association has applied to Sida for funding of SEK 14,5 Million for their rainbow Project 2020-2023. The intervention aim: LGBTI+ rights holders actively safeguard their rights while increasingly holding duty bearers accountable and responsible for protection of rights and equality of LGBTI+ people." The results of the proposed intervention is: - LGBTI+ rights holders (individuals and organizations) are more empowered to enjoy their human rights in a conducive environment - Improved protection and promotion of LGBTI+ rights by key duty-bearers including government at local and central levels and legislators - Judiciary demonstrates responsibility & accountability for providing justice for LGBTI+ rights holders - Private sector improves protection of LGBTI+ rights and protection from discrimination - Independent media and LGBTI+ media sustain the scope of rights based journalism regarding LGBTI+ rights and equality - Key stakeholders act as stronger allies to protect and promote LGBTI+ rights.

Kaos GL har ansökt till Sida om finansiering på 14,5 miljoner kronor för det sk. Regnbågsprojektet 2020-2023. Målet för insatset är att HBTQI + rättighetsbärare aktivt skyddar sina rättigheter samtidigt som de i allt högre grad håller skyldighetsbärare ansvariga för skydd av rättigheter och jämlikhet för HBTQI + -individer . " De förväntade resultaten av den föreslagna insatsen är: -HBTQI + rättighetbärare (individer och organisationer) blir stärkta och får sina mänskliga rättigheter förverkligade i en gynnsam miljö - Förbättrat skydd och främjande av HBTQI + -rättigheter från viktiga aktörer inklusive regering på lokal och central nivå samt lagstiftare - Rättsväsendet visar ansvar och hålls ansvariga för att förverkliga rättvisa för HBTQI + rättighetsbärare - Den privata sektorn förbättrar skyddet av HBTQI + -rättigheter liksom skydd mot diskriminering - Oberoende medier och HBTQI + -medier upprätthåller rättighetsbaserad journalistik angående HBTQI + -rättigheter och jämlikhet - Nyckelintressenter agerar som starkare allierade för att skydda och främja HBTQI + -rättigheter.

Project Overall Objective: LGBTI+ rights holders actively safeguard their rights while increasingly holding duty bearers accountable and responsible for protection of rights and equality of LGBTI+ people. Outcomes: - LGBTI+ rights holders (individuals and organizations) are more empowered to enjoy their human rights in a conducive environment - Improved protection and promotion of LGBTI+ rights by key duty-bearers including government at local and central levels and legislators - Judiciary demonstrates responsibility & accountability for providing justice for LGBTI+ rights holders - Private sector improves protection of LGBTI+ rights and protection from discrimination - Independent media and LGBTI+ media sustain the scope of rights-based journalism regarding LGBTI+ rights and equality - Key stakeholders act as stronger allies to protect and promote LGBTI+ rights

participating-org.narrative: Kaos Gay and Lesbian Cultural Research and Solidarity Association
Kaos Gay and Lesbian Cultural Research and Solidarity Association

tag.narrative: 10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.

10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

description.narrative:
Kaos GL and May 17 works to actively safeguard LGBTQI rights and to increase holding duty bearers accountable and responsible for protection of rights and equality of LGBTQI individuals.
- LGBTQI rights holders (individuals and organizations) are more empowered to enjoy their human rights in a conducive environment
Kaos replied to 246 formal consultancies to 16 (all active) LGBTQI CSOs in Turkey. Kaos GL Refugee Program provided mentorship to 4 LGBTQI organizations for building their capacity to aid refugees or watch refugee rights.
17 May provided mentorship and technical support to 16 LGBTQI organizations in Turkey and 1 in Northern Cyprus to improve their capacity for rights advocacy and has provided mentoring or technical assistance to organizations and professionals 161 times.
17 May began providing individual counseling to LGBTQI persons in Turkey in March of 2021. Between March 2021 and December 2021, 17 May provided 642 total psychosocial and legal guidance services (213 legal counselling, 206 psychological counselling, and 223 social services aid)
Four creative drama workshops, four comic strip/caricature workshops and three networking and activism workshops took place
16 trainings by Kaos GL and 17 May in total (7 by Kaos and 9 by 17 May) on non-violent activism, CSO finance, project cycles, sex worker rights, advocacy, social media campaigns and so on, with a total of 329 participants.
Kaos GL has also organized or attended a total of 77 coordination meetings. 17 May has also organized or attended a total of 61 coordination meetings.
- Improved protection and promotion of LGBTQI rights by key duty-bearers including government at local and central levels and legislators Kaos keeps this result area in case there is an opportunity to achieve results and mainly of their work that they can limitedly carry out with municipalities.
Kaos GL conducted 30 lobbying visits/meetings with 14 Turkish political figures. Five capacity building events were carried out to of 84 participants consisting of duty-bearers, municipalities, MPs, political parties.
- Judiciary demonstrates responsibility & accountability for providing justice for LGBTQI rights holders
The legal team followed 5 cases. 2 cases were brought to the Constitutional Court and 1 case was taken to ECHR.
The legal team gathered information pertaining to the violence inflicted upon LGBTQI individuals and has published the LGBTQI Human Rights Report of 2021.
27 information documents were created for lawyers. 7 events with a participation of 190 people was carried out on strategical litigation.
- Private sector improves protection of LGBTQI rights and protection from discrimination
Kaos is working with Kadir Has University Gender Equality and Women Studies Center and are annually publishing State of LGBTQI in the Public Sector and State of LGBTQI in the Private Sector reports. According to the report, 56.6 percent of the public employees faced hate speech towards LGBTQIs at work. This rate is 36.9 percent in the private sector.
Kaos has conducted negotiations with 4 firms in Turkey namely Nike, Unillever, Inditex and Reckitt and Mazars on supplying training on LGBTQI rights. This is yet to yield results.
- Independent media and LGBTQI media sustain the scope of rights-based journalism regarding LGBTQI rights and equality
2487 news articles, 170 opinion articles and 148 visual content was published a total of 2805 new content was published in Kaos web portal that serves as the information portal for LGBTQI information. 1.589.034 hits and 1.309.109 visitors to KaosGL.org, an increase from the previous year. Kaos GL Magazine and KaosQueer Magazine continued to be published.
The Media School was carried out with 19 participants. 22 comic strips, 24 visual media, 112 news articles were produced and published in the web page.
Media Monitoring Report 2021 was made available in the beginning of February 2022.
- Key stakeholders act as stronger allies to protect and promote LGBTQI rights
Kaos GL has organized, co-hosted or attended 298 events and activities and reached over 7.705 people. In addition, they have attended 404 events as participants, moderators or speakers, and reached over 17.992 people. Kaos GL has also organized or attended a total of 77 coordination meetings, which reached a total of 813 people.
17 May has organized, co-hosted or attended 158 events and activities and reached over 4628 people, they have attended 185 events as participants, moderators or speakers, reaching over 10.812 people. 17 May has also organized or attended a total of 61 coordination meetings, which reached a total of 879 people.
Kaos GL has provided vocational counseling to organizations and professionals (these include municipality personnel, psychologists, teachers, etc. that are considered ad actors for LGBTQI rights) 430 times. Total of 11 events specifically for teachers with a total of 349 participants was conducted.
In regard to May 17 achieving results:
17 Mays Well-Being Program started providing well-being therapy sessions to LGBTQI rights defenders in Turkey to improve well-being, reduce burnout and create sustainability in the movement.
17 May has focused on climate justice and its intersection with LGBTQI it has brought 12 LGBTQI organizations together to discuss climate justice and provided a Climate 101 guideline for them.
17 May also did advocacy work on ageing and the rights of older LGBTQI persons, and created a community network of older LGBTQI . Another first was their report on the rights and situations of older LGBTQI persons in Turkey.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
